author: Rational Animations
description:
This video introduces two broad drivers of catastrophic AI risk (distinct from our usual focus on Rogue AIs): malicious use and accidents.

In particular, we look at how AI could undermine democracy, enable automated cyberattacks on critical infrastructure, lower barriers for biological and chemical misuse, concentrate power in a few governments or corporations, and cause large-scale accidents through bugs, design flaws, and weak safety culture.

▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀SOURCES & READINGS▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀▀

An Overview of Catastrophic AI Risks: https://arxiv.org/pdf/2306.12001.pdf

For more about AI risk from Dan Hendrycks: https://www.aisafetybook.com/

Introduction to ML Safety: https://course.mlsafety.org/about

Tree-Ring Watermarks: Fingerprints for Diffusion Images that are Invisible and Robust https://arxiv.org/abs/2305.20030

Sources about the spread of a deepfake audio during Slovakia's 2023 election:
- https://www.wired.co.uk/article/slovakia-election-deepfakes
- https://www.bloomberg.com/ne
title: Can AI protect us from AI-powered bioterrorism and cyberwarfare?
